structure.unit: Taxation Of Direct Broadcast Satellite Service

text.section: charges for the rental of equipment related to the provision of direct broadcast satellite service;
activation, installation, repair and maintenance charges or similar service charges related to the provision of direct broadcast satellite service;
service order charges, service termination charges or any other administrative charges related to the provision of direct broadcast satellite service;
revenue not actually received, regardless of whether it is billed, including, but not limited to, bad debts;
revenue received by an affiliate or other person in exchange for supplying goods and services used by a direct broadcast satellite service provider;
refunds, rebates or discounts made to subscribers or customers, to advertisers or to other persons;
revenue from service other than direct broadcast satellite service, including:
telecommunications service as defined in 47 U.S.C. section 153(46);
information service as defined in 47 U.S.C. section 153(20); or
any other service that is not a direct broadcast satellite service;
revenue from any service that is subject to tax under chapter 64H or 64I;

the tax imposed by this chapter or any other tax of general applicability imposed on a direct broadcast satellite service provider or a purchaser of direct broadcast satellite service, by a federal, state or local governmental entity and required to be collected by a person and remitted to the taxing entity;

any foregone revenue from providing free or reduced-cost direct broadcast satellite service to any person, including employees of the direct broadcast satellite service provider or any governmental entity as required or authorized by federal, state or local law, except revenue foregone in exchange for the goods or services through a trade or barter arrangement;
revenue from the sale of capital assets or surplus equipment not used by the purchaser to receive direct broadcast satellite service from the direct broadcast satellite service provider;

reimbursements made by programmers to the direct broadcast satellite service provider for marketing costs incurred by the direct broadcast satellite service provider for the introduction of new programming that exceed the actual costs incurred by the direct broadcast satellite service provider;
late payment fees collected from subscribers or customers; or

charges, other than those charges specifically described herein, that are aggregated or bundled with such specifically-described charges on a subscriber or customerâ€™s bill, if the direct broadcast satellite service provider can reasonably identify the charges in its books and records kept in the regular course of business.
